poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The baby could say uno Due, tre in good Italian But still said cheese for trees; I now hear why. The tr is ch, but said with the tip Instead of blade on dental ridge ; A separate R - t-rue - is bold italic. Otherwise an individual sound but for the faint Retroflexion, the sliding fall To drip drap drape dreep drop droop Even drupe, the chosen fruit, While dip gets only deep, Dark on the water.
